document.full_text: much of the tilapia farmed in china for export is frozen and then treated with carbon monoxide, a gas that prevents meat and seafood from discoloring as it ages; when it is thawed, it looks like new.
document.title: when 'fresh' fish is really frozen
lines_and_colors: much of the tilapia farmed in china for export is frozen and then treated with carbon monoxide, a gas that prevents meat and seafood from discoloring as it ages; when it is thawed, it looks like new.
